dreisoft.tresos.generator.api.generator

Class GeneratorWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.io.Writer
      • java.io.PrintWriter
        • dreisoft.tresos.generator.api.generator.GeneratorWriter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.io.Flushable, java.lang.Appendable, java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public class GeneratorWriter
extends java.io.PrintWriter
    This is the implementation of a PrintWriter that should be used to generate files. Instances of this class are created by CodeGeneratorContext.

    Features

    The GeneratorWriter already handles verifying generators and not overwriting generated files that did not change. It also bothers if empty files shall be created or not. Behaviour:
    • In case of a verifying generator no output is generated at all.
    • If files should only be generated if their content changed against the last time the file was generated this writer first checks if the file changed and only writes the file if it did.
    • This writer also created missing directories automatically.
    • If generation fails the generator removes the generated file and creates an info OperationStatus documenting this
    • OperationStatus are generated for created directories
    • If output is redirected to a StringBuffer with startRedirect(StringBuffer) all output is written temporary to that StringBuffer.
    When generation fails either cancel() can be called which is a substitute for close() that does not write the file or PrintWriter.setError() can be called in which case close() or cancel() do both not write the file.

    Usage

    A GeneratorWriter is obtained via the CodeGeneratorContext: 

     GeneratorWriter moduleCfg = ctxt.getWriter("Module_Cfg.h");
 moduleCfg.printf("/* Copyright (C) 1977, %s", companyName);

    Copyright (C) Elektrobit Automotive GmbH - All rights reserved

    Redirection

    When using generator like a Jet engine output can be temporary redirected to a StringBuffer with: startRedirect(StringBuffer). If a redirection has been set all output is written to this StringBuffer. The redirection can be later on canceled with stopRedirected(boolean). This method is capable to automatically append the content of the StringBuffer to the output of the GeneratorWriter.

    Auto Close

    When a generator finished his work all still open GeneratorWriters are either closed when no error has been reported or canceled if errors have been reported.

    Creation of empty files

    If nothing is actually written before the writer is closed, the writer may either create an empty output file, or no file at all, depending on CodeGeneratorContext.isCreateEmptyFiles().

    Since:
    2008.b

    • Method Detail

      • startRedirect

        public void startRedirect(java.lang.StringBuffer buffer)
        Temporarily redirects all output to a StringBuffer. The redirection can be dropped by calling stopRedirected(boolean). The GeneratorWriter allows nested redirection.
        Any stale redirects will be discarded when the writer is closed or canceled. A warning will be issued in this case only if the platform is running in debug mode (see Platform.inDebugMode()).
        Parameters:
        buffer - The StringBuffer to which to redirect
        Since:
        2008.b

      • stopRedirected

        public void stopRedirected(boolean append)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Cancels a previously redirection set via startRedirect(StringBuffer).
        Parameters:
        append - Append the content of the redirected StringBuffer to the output
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        Since:
        2008.b

      • getRedirectionCount

        public int getRedirectionCount()
        Returns the current count of redirections. The redirection counter is incremented at any call to startRedirect(StringBuffer) and decremented at any call to stopRedirected(boolean).
        Returns:
        the redirection's count.
        Since:
        2009.a

      • cancel

        public void cancel()
        This method can be called instead of close() to cancel creating the file. When this method is called instead of close() the file is not written. Instead the file is removed.
        Since:
        2008.b

      • close

        public void close()
        Writes the file if necessary and close the writer. If the "createEmptyFiles" parameter is false and the file that should be written is empty then the file will not be saved/generated. If an error is set with PrintWriter.setError() the file is removed.
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.io.Closeable

        close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable
        Overrides:
        close in class java.io.PrintWriter
        Since:
        2008.b
